summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, a former member of the boy band *NSYNC, addresses fan speculation about a potential reunion tour by stating there is no current plan, while emphasizing his ongoing work to educate the public about his personal experience with type 1.5 diabetes, specifically latent autoimmune diabetes of adults (LADA). He shares how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 continuous glucose monitor has improved his daily management, and uses the humorous online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram to demystify diabetes and promote awareness. He highlights dietary triggers such as white rice and white bread, which cause significant blood sugar spikes, and discusses how stress from his busy career and parenting his twin children impacts his health. The article underscores both the personal and public relevance of his advocacy in normalizing conversations around diabetes in a relatable, accessible, and entertaining manner.
title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living With Diabetes Than an *NSYNC Reunion
